author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...RAYMOND FORECAST TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW TONIGHT... ...REMNANT MOISTURE TO BRING A RISK OF FLASH FLOODING TO NORTHWESTERN MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES...
summary: ...RAYMOND FORECAST TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW TONIGHT... ...REMNANT MOISTURE TO BRING A RISK OF FLASH FLOODING TO NORTHWESTERN MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES... As of 2:00 PM MST Sat Oct 11 the center of Raymond was located near 22.5, -109.9 with movement NNW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...RAYMOND FORECAST TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW TONIGHT... ...REMNANT MOISTURE TO BRING A RISK OF FLASH FLOODING TO NORTHWESTERN MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES... As of 2:00 PM MST Sat Oct 11 the center of Raymond was located near 22.5, -109.9 with movement NNW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Depression Raymond (EP2/EP172025)
